term.name: neo-Platonism
term.def: The doctrines of Plotinus (205-270 CE) and his followers, or more generally the tradition of such thought stretching from late antiquity into the Middle Ages and early Renaissance. Neo-Platonism put greater emphasis on Plato's &dualism; and &idealism;, even to the point of a &spiritualism; that early Christian theologians like Augustine found congenial despite the basic &pantheism; of neo-Platonic ideas. The modern understanding of &aristotelianism; is heavily influenced by neo-Platonic interpretations.
